title: 05 - Break of Structure (BOS)

metadata.key_emphasis: BOS is INDICATION (not confirmation) of trend continuation - requires 2 rules for validation

break_of_structure.llm_summary: Break of Structure (BOS) indicates the CONTINUATION of forex trend. In a bullish market, BOS occurs when price breaks the previous swing high (bullish continuation). In a bearish market, BOS occurs when price breaks the previous swing low (bearish continuation). CRITICAL: BOS is just an INDICATION of trend continuation, NOT confirmation. BOS is timeframe-dependent - each timeframe (Daily, H4, H1, M15) has its own BOS levels. NOT every break of a high or low qualifies as a valid BOS - validation requires following 2 specific rules that separate Smart Money traders from retail traders.

definition.bullish_market: When market breaks its previous swing high for bullish continuation
definition.bearish_market: When market breaks its previous swing low for bearish continuation

timeframe_dependency.principle: BOS depends on timeframe used for analysis
examples: Daily timeframe has its own BOS
H4 timeframe has its own BOS
M15 has its own BOS levels
timeframe_dependency.implication: Must analyze BOS relative to your trading timeframe

break_of_structure.critical_distinction: BOS is just INDICATION of trend continuation, NOT confirmation
break_of_structure.validation_requirement: Not every break is a valid BOS - must follow 2 rules
key_rules: BOS = breaking previous swing high (bullish) or swing low (bearish)
BOS indicates trend continuation (not reversal)
BOS is INDICATION, not confirmation
BOS is timeframe-specific
Requires validation via 2 rules to be considered valid
Without rules, traders mark fake BOS

visual_evidence.description: BOS definition with bullish and bearish examples

Retail vs Smart Money approach to marking BOS

retail_vs_smc_bos_approach.llm_summary: Retail traders mark EVERY break of a high or low as a valid Break of Structure due to lack of knowledge and no rules. They consider every breakout valid without any filtering criteria. Smart Money (SMC) traders use a rule-based approach and mark ONLY certain breaks as valid BOS while identifying others as FAKE BOS. The difference between retail and SMC approach is the application of 2 validation rules. This fundamental difference separates profitable traders from those who get trapped. Retail traders get confused and lose money because they mark invalid BOS levels, while SMC traders filter out fake breaks and trade only valid structure breaks.

retail_trader_approach.method: Mark every break as valid BOS
retail_trader_approach.criteria: No rules - if high/low is broken, it's BOS
retail_trader_approach.reason: Lack of knowledge and no validation rules
retail_trader_approach.result: Mark many fake BOS, get trapped, losses

smc_trader_approach.method: Mark only certain breaks as valid BOS
smc_trader_approach.marking_behavior: Filter fake BOS from valid BOS
smc_trader_approach.result: Only trade valid BOS, avoid traps, profits

retail_vs_smc_bos_approach.key_difference: Rules to map Break of Structure - everything in universe is based on set of rules to minimize risk

example_from_video.scenario: Same market structure given to retail and SMC traders
example_from_video.retail_marks: All 5 breaks as valid BOS (every breakout)
example_from_video.smc_marks: Only 2 breaks as valid BOS, 3 as fake BOS
example_from_video.reason_for_difference: SMC applies inducement rule, retail doesn't

key_rules: Retail marks every break without validation
SMC marks only breaks that follow 2 rules
Rules minimize risk and filter fake BOS
Rule-based approach is what separates winners from losers
Without rules, traders mark invalid BOS and lose

visual_evidence.description: Side-by-side comparison: Retail approach (all BOS valid) vs Smart Money approach (selective BOS)

bos_validation_rule_1.llm_summary: RULE 1 for Valid BOS: Price swing MUST take out the inducement. This is the PRIMARY and MOST IMPORTANT rule. Before price can create a valid Break of Structure, it MUST first sweep the inducement level (the pullback that occurred before the current high). CRITICAL CLARIFICATION: For Rule 1, candle closing below inducement is NOT compulsory - both candle wick sweep AND body close below inducement are VALID to mark BOS. This is different from other concepts where body close is required. If price breaks a high WITHOUT taking out inducement first, it is a FAKE BOS (invalid).
bos_validation_rule_1.rule_statement: Price swing must take out the inducement

critical_clarification.candle_close_requirement: Candle closing below inducement is NOT compulsory for Rule 1
valid_methods: Candle body close below inducement (also valid)
critical_clarification.key_point: Both wick sweep AND body close are acceptable for inducement takeout

validation_sequence.step1: Identify the inducement level (pullback before current high)
validation_sequence.step2: Check if price took out (swept) this inducement
validation_sequence.step3_if_yes: Rule 1 fulfilled - continue to check Rule 2
validation_sequence.step3_if_no: FAKE BOS - invalid Break of Structure

examples.valid_bos: Price sweeps inducement (wick or body), then creates new high = Rule 1 fulfilled
examples.fake_bos: Price creates new high WITHOUT sweeping inducement = Rule 1 NOT fulfilled = invalid BOS

bos_validation_rule_1.builds_on_previous_videos: If you don't know what inducement is, watch Videos 3 and 4 - guaranteed to be forex life-changing
key_rules: Price MUST take out inducement before BOS is valid
Candle wick sweep of inducement = valid (closing NOT required)
Candle body close below inducement = also valid
Both wick and body methods acceptable for Rule 1
No inducement sweep = FAKE BOS
This rule filters out most retail fake BOS markings

visual_evidence.description: Rule 1: Price must take out inducement (body closing not compulsory)
Smart Money approach showing valid BOS with inducement marked

bos_validation_rule_2.llm_summary: RULE 2 for Valid BOS: After taking out inducement, candle body MUST close ABOVE previous high (bullish) or BELOW previous low (bearish). This is the CONFIRMATION rule. Unlike Rule 1, Rule 2 is STRICT about candle body close - a wick-only break is NOT sufficient. The candle BODY must close beyond the previous highest candle's high. If candle only wicks above high but body closes below it, this is a LIQUIDITY SWEEP (invalid BOS). TRICKY SCENARIO: If first candle wicks above high but doesn't close above, wait for NEXT candle - if next candle's body closes above the sweeping candle's wick high, THEN it becomes valid BOS.
bos_validation_rule_2.rule_statement: After taking out inducement, candle body must close above previous high (bullish) or below previous low (bearish)

body_close_requirement.strictness: BODY close is REQUIRED for Rule 2 (unlike Rule 1)
body_close_requirement.wick_only: Wick-only break = NOT valid BOS = liquidity sweep
body_close_requirement.confirmation: Body close confirms the break is genuine, not just liquidity hunt

simple_scenario.clear_case: Candle body clearly closes above previous high

tricky_scenario.situation: Candle wicks above high but body closes below it
tricky_scenario.immediate_assessment: NOT valid BOS - this is liquidity sweep
tricky_scenario.if_next_candle_breaks_wick_high: If next candle body closes above sweeping candle's wick high = becomes valid BOS
tricky_scenario.reasoning: We need candle body close above previous highest point (even if that point is a wick)

liquidity_sweep_vs_bos.liquidity_sweep: Wick breaks high, body closes below = invalid BOS
liquidity_sweep_vs_bos.valid_bos: Body closes above high = valid BOS
liquidity_sweep_vs_bos.delayed_validation: Wick sweep + next candle body close above wick = valid BOS

candle_closing_analysis_steps.step1: Always start with Rule 1 (inducement taken out?)
candle_closing_analysis_steps.step2: Check if candle body closed above previous high
candle_closing_analysis_steps.step3b_if_no_wick_only: Liquidity sweep - wait for next candle
candle_closing_analysis_steps.step4: If next candle body closes above wick high = valid BOS

reference_candle_identification.bullish_market: Identify the HIGHEST candle before the break
reference_candle_identification.bearish_market: Identify the LOWEST candle before the break
reference_candle_identification.target_for_break: Body must close above high of highest candle (bullish) or below low of lowest candle (bearish)

key_rules: Candle BODY must close above previous high (Rule 2 is strict)
Wick-only break = liquidity sweep (invalid BOS)
Always wait for next candle if first sweep is wick-only
Next candle body close above wick high = valid BOS
Body close confirms genuine break vs liquidity hunt
Must identify correct reference candle (highest/lowest)

liquidity_sweep_vs_bos.llm_summary: Liquidity Sweep occurs when price wicks above a high (or below a low) but the candle body does NOT close beyond it. This is NOT a valid Break of Structure - it's Smart Money hunting stop losses and pending orders. The distinction between liquidity sweep and BOS is CRITICAL: Liquidity sweep = wick-only break with body closing back inside range (invalid BOS). Valid BOS = body close beyond the level (genuine break). When you see a wick sweep, mark it as liquidity sweep, NOT as BOS. However, if the NEXT candle's body closes beyond the wick high, it converts from liquidity sweep to valid BOS.

liquidity_sweep_characteristics.wick_behavior: Wick breaks above high or below low
liquidity_sweep_characteristics.body_behavior: Body closes back inside the range
liquidity_sweep_characteristics.smart_money_purpose: Hunt stop losses and pending orders
liquidity_sweep_characteristics.marking: Mark as liquidity sweep, NOT BOS

conversion_scenario.conversion_trigger: Next candle body closes above wick high
conversion_scenario.result: Converts from liquidity sweep to valid BOS
conversion_scenario.reasoning: Body close requirement fulfilled by subsequent candle

identification_process.step3a_body_inside: Liquidity sweep - mark with X, wait for next candle
identification_process.step4: If next candle breaks wick high with body = upgrade to valid BOS

key_rules: Wick-only break = liquidity sweep (not BOS)
Body close beyond level = valid BOS
Mark liquidity sweeps separately from BOS
Always wait for next candle after wick sweep
Next candle can convert liquidity sweep to valid BOS
This distinction prevents false BOS markings

visual_evidence.description: Liquidity sweep labeled on chart (wick only, body closed below)
Comparison of liquidity sweep vs valid BOS

bos_two_rules_summary.llm_summary: Valid Break of Structure requires BOTH rules to be fulfilled: Rule 1 - Price must take out inducement (wick or body sweep both valid), and Rule 2 - Candle body must close above previous high (bullish) or below previous low (bearish). These two rules work together as a filtering system. Rule 1 ensures Smart Money has collected liquidity from inducement before the move. Rule 2 ensures the break is genuine (body close) rather than just a liquidity hunt (wick only). If market follows both rules, ONLY THEN mark the break as valid BOS. This rule-based approach is what separates successful Smart Money traders from retail traders who mark fake BOS.

rule_1_recap.valid_methods: Wick sweep OR body close (both acceptable)
rule_1_recap.compulsory: Body closing NOT compulsory for Rule 1

rule_2_recap.requirement: Candle body close above previous high (bullish) or below previous low (bearish)
rule_2_recap.compulsory: Body closing IS compulsory for Rule 2

validation_checklist.step1: Check Rule 1: Did price take out inducement?
validation_checklist.step2: Check Rule 2: Did candle body close above high/below low?

filtering_mechanism.combined_effect: Only genuine structure breaks pass both filters

importance.minimizes_risk: Rules minimize risk in forex market
importance.separates_traders: Rule-based approach separates SMC from retail
importance.ensures_accuracy: Both rules ensure valid BOS identification
importance.prevents_traps: Avoid Smart Money traps by following rules

key_rules: Both Rule 1 AND Rule 2 must be fulfilled
Rule 1: Inducement taken out (wick or body)
Rule 2: Body close above high / below low
If both rules met = valid BOS
If any rule fails = fake/invalid BOS
This is the foundation of valid structure mapping

visual_evidence.description: Rules applied to chart with inducement and BOS marked

key_quotes: Break of structure, BOS, indicates the continuation of forex trend.
When market is bullish and break its previous swing high for bullish continuation.
BOS depends on time frame you using for analysis. It varies time frame to time frame.
BOS is just a indication of a trend continuation, not confirmation.
Is every break of high or low is a break of structure?
Retail trader will consider that every break is a break of structure due to lack of knowledge and no rules.
SMC traders marked only these points as valid break of structure. They marked other three breakouts as fake BOS.
Answer of this question is rules to map break of structure. Everything in this universe is based on set of rules.
There are basically two rules to identify a valid break of structure.
First, price must take out the inducement. And please note that candle closing below inducement is now really important. Candle sweep or body close, both cases are valid to mark break of structure.
Second, candle body must close above previous high.
If market will follow these two basic rules, only then we will mark the break as valid break of structure.

If you don't know what inducement is, you can visit our YouTube channel and watch third and fourth lecture. I guarantee you that if you spare 30 minutes for these videos, it will be forex life changing concepts for you.
Second rule is bit tricky. If we have a clear candle closing above high, then it's pretty easy to mark out valid BOS.
If the high of the sweeping candle broke and taken out by next candle's body closing, then this is also a valid break of structure.
This candle just sweep the previous high and closed below the high of previous highest candle. So, we will market his BOS as invalid break of structure. Such cases are known as liquidity sweep.
Always wait for next new candle.

critical_insights.main_teaching: BOS indicates (not confirms) trend continuation and requires 2 validation rules to separate valid from fake BOS
critical_insights.key_distinction: BOS is INDICATION, not confirmation of trend continuation
critical_insights.rule_1_importance: Inducement must be taken out - filters breaks without Smart Money liquidity collection
critical_insights.rule_2_importance: Body close required - filters liquidity sweeps from genuine breaks
critical_insights.video_5_adds: What BOS is, 2 rules for validation, liquidity sweep vs BOS distinction, candle closing mechanics
critical_insights.practical_application: Before marking BOS: Check Rule 1 (inducement swept?), Check Rule 2 (body close above high?), both must be YES
critical_insights.retail_vs_smc: Retail marks every break as BOS (no rules), SMC marks only validated breaks (rule-based)
